body:
With ruby 1.9.2 difference is x6 %( Can we use [[:space:]] group in ruby 1.9.2?

```ruby
#encoding: utf-8
require 'benchmark'

N = 100_000

BLANKS = ['', '   ', "  \n\t  \r ", '　']

def bm
  BLANKS.each {|str| N.times { yield str } }
end

Benchmark.bm do |x|
  x.report("old   ") { bm {|str| str !~ /\S/ } }
  x.report("new   ") { bm {|str| str !~ /[^\s#{[[0x3000].pack('U')]}]/ } }
  x.report("new v2") { bm {|str| str !~ /[^[:space:]]/ }}
end
```

```
⚡ ruby benchmark.rb
      user     system      total        real
old     0.390000   0.010000   0.400000 (  0.424615)
new     6.340000   0.020000   6.360000 (  6.446839)
new v2  0.440000   0.000000   0.440000 (  0.435100)
```
